title: IMD predicts longer heat waves and high temperatures in India this summer
text: Heatwaves have been predicted in many areas of central India, adjoining areas of northern plains, and south India. IMD has predicted above-maximum temperatures in the country from April to June. |Date:India | April 01, 2024 17:30 IST

title: Delhi-NCR wakes up to drizzle, IMD issues orange alert | Check weather forecast
text: The weatherman had also predicted light to medium rainfall in Delhi-NCR, Punjab, Haryana and parts of Rajasthan mainly for March 1 and 2. In addition, thunderstorms and gusty winds along with hailstorms have also been predicted in isolated places for March 2. |Date:March 02, 2024 12:41 IST

title: Above-normal maximum temperatures likely in February over parts of India: IMD amid rain in Delhi-NCR
text: The average maximum temperature in Delhi this month stood at 17.7 degrees Celsius, the lowest in 13 years, according to an official data till Tuesday. The average minimum temperature in the national capital during the same period was pegged at 6.2 degrees Celsius, the second lowest in 13 years. |Date:India | January 31, 2024 18:50 IST

title: Ram Mandir Pran Pratishtha: Check Ayodhya's weather forecast for today

title: Delhi shivers as mercury hits season's lowest at 3.5째C; air quality plunges to 'severe'
text: Delhi faces its coldest spell of the winter with a minimum temperature of 3.5 degrees Celsius, marking the season's lowest. The Central Pollution Control Board records a 'severe' Air Quality Index (AQI) at 447, accompanied by dense fog, the longest this season. |Date:January 14, 2024 22:02 IST

title: Tamil Nadu: Incessant rains damage harvest-ready crops, AIADMK chief demands compensation for farmer

title: Delhi air quality remains in 'very poor' category for second consecutive day, AQI at 322
text: Noida witnessed air quality in 'very poor' category as well with AQI soaring to 322. title: Cyclone Hamoon makes landfall in Bangladesh coast area, Tej weakens into Cyclonic Storm in Yemen
text: The Severe Cyclonic Storm 'Hamoon' over Northeast Bay of Bengal lay centered at 2330 hours IST on Tuesday night about 420 km east-southeast of Digha (West Bengal), 150 km east-southeast of Khepupara (Bangladesh) and 80 km south-southwest of Chittagong (Bangladesh), said IMD. |Date:India | October 25, 2023 9:54 IST
